document_info.title: Pocket Guide for Asthma Management and Prevention

disease_definition.primary_definition: A chronic disease usually characterized by airway inflammation.

typical_characteristics: More than one symptom (wheeze, shortness of breath, cough, chest tightness)
Symptoms occur variably over time and intensity
Symptoms often worse at night or on waking
Triggered by exercise, laughter, allergens, cold air

pef_variability.calculation: (Highest - Lowest) / Mean of Highest and Lowest

anti_inflammatory_trial.criteria_adults: FEV1 increase >12% and >200 mL from baseline

diagnostic_flowchart_steps.query: Does patient have respiratory symptoms typical of asthma?
diagnostic_flowchart_steps.if_no: Further history and tests for alternative diagnoses.

diagnostic_flowchart_steps.query: Does detailed history/examination support asthma diagnosis?
diagnostic_flowchart_steps.if_no: Further history and tests for alternative diagnoses.

diagnostic_flowchart_steps.query: Is patient already taking ICS-containing treatment?
diagnostic_flowchart_steps.if_yes: See GINA 2023 report for diagnostic steps in treated patients.

diagnostic_flowchart_steps.if_no: Repeat testing (symptomatic/early morning/withholding meds) or Arrange other tests (bronchial challenge).

diagnostic_flowchart_steps.condition: Clinical urgency and other diagnoses unlikely
diagnostic_flowchart_steps.action: Start empiric initial treatment -> Review response in 1-3 months.

questions: Any night waking due to asthma?
Any activity limitation due to asthma?

exacerbation_risk_independent_of_symptom: Inadequate ICS (not prescribed, poor adherence, incorrect technique)
Comorbidities (obesity, rhinosinusitis, GERD, food allergy, pregnancy)
Type 2 inflammatory markers (high eosinophils, high FeNO)
One or more severe exacerbations in last 12 months
persistent_airflow_limitation_risks: Lack of ICS treatment with history of severe exacerbation

track_1.mechanism_benefit: Reduces risk of severe exacerbations compared to SABA reliever regimens; simpler regimen.

usage_steps.step_3: Low dose maintenance ICS-formoterol + As-needed reliever.
usage_steps.step_4: Medium dose maintenance ICS-formoterol + As-needed reliever.
usage_steps.step_5: Add-on LAMA; Refer for assessment; Consider high dose maintenance ICS-formoterol.

track_2.safety_prerequisite: Check if patient is likely to adhere to daily controller. Otherwise, risk of SABA-only outcomes.

usage_steps.step_1: Take low dose ICS whenever SABA taken.
usage_steps.step_5: Add-on LAMA; Refer for assessment; Consider high dose ICS-LABA.

adults_adolescents.track_2_recommendation: Step 1: Take ICS whenever SABA taken

adults_adolescents.symptoms: Most days OR waking with asthma once a week or more
Daily symptoms OR waking with asthma once a week or more AND Low lung function

adults_adolescents.presentation: Severely uncontrolled asthma or acute exacerbation
adults_adolescents.action: Short course OCS; Start High Dose ICS or Medium Dose ICS-formoterol (Step 4)

children_6_11_years.recommendation: Step 1: Low dose ICS whenever SABA taken

children_6_11_years.symptoms: Twice a month or more, but less than daily
Most days OR waking with asthma once a week or more
children_6_11_years.recommendation: Step 3: Low dose ICS-LABA OR Medium dose ICS OR Very low dose ICS-formoterol MART

children_6_11_years.symptoms: Most days OR waking with asthma once a week or more AND Low lung function
children_6_11_years.recommendation: Step 4: Medium dose ICS-LABA OR Low dose ICS-formoterol MART; Refer for expert advice

budesonide_formoterol_dpi_200_6.step_3: 1 inhalation once daily PLUS 1 inhalation whenever needed
budesonide_formoterol_dpi_200_6.step_4: 1 inhalation twice daily PLUS 1 inhalation whenever needed
budesonide_formoterol_dpi_200_6.step_5: 2 inhalations twice daily PLUS 1 inhalation whenever needed

beclometasone_formoterol_pmdi_100_6.step_3: 1 inhalation twice daily PLUS 1 inhalation whenever needed
beclometasone_formoterol_pmdi_100_6.step_4: 2 inhalations twice daily PLUS 1 inhalation whenever needed
beclometasone_formoterol_pmdi_100_6.step_5: 2 inhalations twice daily PLUS 1 inhalation whenever needed

treatment.saba: 4-10 puffs by pMDI + spacer, repeat every 20 mins for 1 hour

severe.treatment: Transfer to acute care facility. While waiting: Give SABA, Ipratropium bromide, Oxygen, Systemic corticosteroid

life_threatening.treatment: URGENT transfer to acute care facility

for_track_1_patients.reliever_instruction: Take extra doses of low-dose ICS-formoterol whenever needed.
for_track_1_patients.medical_attention_threshold: Rapidly deteriorating OR needing >12 inhalations/day (Budesonide-Formoterol) or >8 inhalations/day (Beclometasone-Formoterol).

for_track_2_patients_saba_reliever.maintenance_instruction_ics_only: Increase maintenance ICS dose by 4x (Adults). Note: 5x increase in children not likely effective.
for_track_2_patients_saba_reliever.maintenance_instruction_ics_formoterol: Increase maintenance dose to 4x usual dose (observe daily max).
for_track_2_patients_saba_reliever.maintenance_instruction_ics_other_laba: Step up to higher dose formulation or add separate ICS inhaler.
for_track_2_patients_saba_reliever.medical_attention_threshold: Rapidly deteriorating OR need SABA again within 3 hours.

covid_19.medication_advice: Continue ICS and biologics. Stopping ICS increases risk of dangerous worsening. Avoid nebulizers to prevent viral transmission.
covid_19.risk_clarification: People with well-controlled asthma NOT at increased risk of severe COVID-19. Risk increases if recent OCS use or hospitalization.
covid_19.vaccination: Recommended. Do not administer biologic and vaccine on same day.
covid_19.drug_interaction_warning: Ritonavir-boosted nirmatrelvir (Paxlovid) interaction with Salmeterol or Vilanterol may cause cardiac toxicity.

pregnancy.medication_safety: Benefits of active treatment outweigh potential risks. Do NOT step down treatment. Treat exacerbations aggressively.
pregnancy.labor_delivery: Stress-dose hydrocortisone if on high-dose ICS or OCS >2 weeks in last 6 months.

surgery.protocol: Achieve good control pre-op. Maintain ICS. Give stress-dose hydrocortisone if on long-term high-dose ICS or recent OCS.

obesity.impact: Weight loss of 5-10% can improve asthma control.

aspirin_exacerbated_respiratory_disease_.clinical_triad: Severe asthma + Nasal polyposis + Reaction to NSAIDs.
aspirin_exacerbated_respiratory_disease_.management: Avoid NSAIDs. ICS is mainstay. LTRA may be useful. Desensitization possible in specialist centers.

inhaler_technique_adherence.technique_failure_rate: Up to 80% of patients cannot use inhaler correctly.
intervention_steps: Choose appropriate device for patient skills/cost
inhaler_technique_adherence.adherence_failure_rate: At least 50% of adults/children do not take medications as prescribed.

laba.safety_warning: Should NOT be used without ICS in asthma.

ltra.safety_warning: FDA boxed warning for Montelukast (serious mental health effects).

lama.role: Add-on at Step 5. Modest lung function improvement. No symptom benefit.
